radiographic_examinations.findings: Positive late fluorescein staining over the vascularized corneal regions in all patients.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilateral peripheral vascularization gradually progressed on the corneal surface in four patients but remained stationary in the remaining three patients.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed conjunctivalization by showing conjunctival goblet cells on the corneal surface.

Bilateral limbal and peripheral corneal scarring and vascularization, irregular scalloped epithelial appearance, loss of limbal palisades of Vogt, superÔ¨Åcial vascularization observed predominantly in the superior quadrant.
